-- | <tt>multipart/form-data</tt> client-side support for servant. See
--   servant-multipart-api for the API definitions.
module Servant.Multipart.Client

-- | Generates a boundary to be used to separate parts of the multipart.
--   Requires <a>IO</a> because it is randomized.
genBoundary :: IO ByteString

-- | Allows you to tell servant how to turn a more structured type into a
--   <a>MultipartData</a>, which is what is actually sent by the client.
--   
--   <pre>
--   data User = User { username :: Text, pic :: FilePath }
--   
--   instance toMultipart Tmp User where
--       toMultipart user = MultipartData [Input "username" $ username user]
--                                        [FileData "pic"
--                                                  (pic user)
--                                                  "image/png"
--                                                  (pic user)
--                                        ]
--   
--   </pre>
class ToMultipart tag a

-- | Given a value of type <tt>a</tt>, convert it to a
--   <a>MultipartData</a>.
toMultipart :: ToMultipart tag a => a -> MultipartData tag

-- | Given a bytestring for the boundary, turns a <a>MultipartData</a> into
--   a <a>RequestBody</a>
multipartToBody :: forall tag. MultipartClient tag => ByteString -> MultipartData tag -> RequestBody
instance (Servant.Multipart.API.ToMultipart tag a, Servant.Client.Core.HasClient.HasClient m api, Servant.Multipart.Client.MultipartClient tag) => Servant.Client.Core.HasClient.HasClient m (Servant.Multipart.API.MultipartForm' mods tag a Servant.API.Sub.:> api)
instance Servant.Multipart.Client.MultipartClient Servant.Multipart.API.Tmp
instance Servant.Multipart.Client.MultipartClient Servant.Multipart.API.Mem
